thread.title: Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid
thread.title_full: Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid
text:
Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid 'Extreme vetting' of Muslim immigrants comes when USA aims for 2024 Games. Post to Facebook Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid 'Extreme vetting' of Muslim immigrants comes when USA aims for 2024 Games.  //usat.ly/2kDunyE   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Trump says he 'doesn't know' if immigration policy will affect L.A. Olympic bid Martin Rogers , USA TODAY Sports 8:49 p.m. ET Feb. 5, 2017 President Donald Trump and First Lady Melania Trump watch the Super Bowl at a party at Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, Fla. (Photo: Susan Walsh, AP) 
HOUSTON – Donald Trump admitted he “doesn’t know” if his stance on immigration will have a detrimental effect on Los Angeles’ bid to host the 2024 Summer Olympics. 
Speaking on Westwood One radio, Trump gave his backing to the Games bid, yet remained steadfast in his approach of “extreme vetting” relating to immigrants and visitors from certain countries. 
“I’ve been asked to support (the bid) and I’ve actually spoken to the Olympic Committee in Europe,” Trump told interviewer Jim Gray. “They wanted to have an endorsement from me and I was happy to give it. I would love to see the Olympics go to L.A. It would be terrific. Let’s see what happens. I would be very happy and honored if they chose it.” Robert Alford's pick-six of Tom Brady electrifies Falcons in Super Bowl 
When asked if he believed his policies would make it tougher for Los Angeles to win the bidding, Trump responded: “I don’t know. 
“But regardless we have to have security in our country. We have to know who is coming in, if people are coming in with bad intentions we need to know. They have to come with good intentions, we want strong borders and extreme vetting.” 
Despite widespread protests in several parts of the country since his inauguration, Trump said he was pleased with the first two weeks of his presidency. 
“I think I’ve done well I think the polls have shown I’ve done well,” Trump added. “It’s tough for people, we are breaking the glass a little bit. It would be very easy (for me) to let it be the way it was. Frankly we have to have a safe country…I think I’m getting high marks from a lot of people.” GALLERY: Images from Lady Gaga's halftime show Facebook A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
